TEXT: The applicant , PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in FAC . He was represented before the ORG by Mr PERSON , of FAC .
The applicant is head of the arbitrage department of ORG , a company , and is in charge of the transactions carried out by ORG , a commercial partnership in which ORG has a stake of PERCENT .

In the light of a report drawn up by its inspectors following an inquiry , ORG des opérations de bourse ) applied to ORG ( ORG financiers – “ the ORG ” ) to have disciplinary proceedings instituted against the applicant .
On DATE the chairman of the ORG notified the applicant of the complaints against him .
On DATE ORG , exercising its disciplinary powers , decided to suspend the applicant ’s trading licence for DATE and fined him MONEY .
On DATE the applicant brought an action in the ORG d’Etat , seeking to have the decision in issue quashed and its execution stayed .

On DATE the ORG d’Etat dismissed the applicant ’s action . It held , in particular , that when dealing with a case concerning acts for which disciplinary penalties could be imposed , “ ORG must be regarded as determining criminal charges within the meaning of the aforementioned provisions of the ... Convention for ORG ” .

“ Seeing that an action may be brought in the PERSON d’Etat in respect of a decision by ORG , the fact that proceedings before ORG might not satisfy the requirements of LAW in every respect can not be taken to constitute an infringement of the right to a fair hearing in all such cases .

However , even though ORG , when exercising its disciplinary powers , is not a court under domestic law , the ground of appeal to the effect that the manner in which it dealt with the case contravened the principle of impartiality set forth in the aforementioned LAW may , having regard to its nature , membership and functions , be validly relied on in support of an action in the ORG d’Etat in respect of a decision by ORG .

... the rapporteur , who does not initiate the referral process , plays no part in the formulation of complaints . He does not have the power to discontinue proceedings or , conversely , to broaden the scope of a case . The investigative powers he enjoys in assessing the validity of the complaints and of the observations of the person against whom proceedings have been brought do not authorise him to make searches or seizures or to take any other coercive measures during the investigation . In the present case ... it has not been established , or even alleged , that in performing his duties the rapporteur exceeded the powers which were conferred on him by the provisions cited above and which are no different from those available to ORG disciplinary panel itself . Consequently , his participation in the deliberations and vote that resulted in the imposition of a penalty on PERSON did not give rise to any breach of the principle of impartiality as set forth in LAW . ”
The relevant provisions of Decree no . CARDINAL of DATE on the disciplinary panels of ORG are worded as follows :

“ The decision shall be served on the person concerned and on the Government Commissioner by means of a registered letter with recorded delivery . The ORG shall , where appropriate , notify its decision to the referring entity . Persons on whom penalties are imposed and the Minister for ORG and Finance shall have DATE to bring an action in the ORG d’Etat ; in the Minister ’s case , that time shall start to run from the date on which the decision is served on the Government Commissioner . ... ”
